snippet: Vatican City’s all-amateur team played Monaco in its first match in almost a year. With only around 900 citizens, the Vatican has a tough time getting a team together.
abstract: Vatican City’s soccer team plays Monaco in its first match in almost a year, losing 2-0; Vatican, one of just a handful of sovereign states that are not members of FIFA, soccer's global governing body, has a tough time getting a team together; players are deeply religious and wholly amateur, all employees of the Vatican--police officers, postal workers, government officials and members of the Swiss Guard.
lead_paragraph: Vatican City’s all-amateur team played Monaco in its first match in almost a year. With only around 900 citizens, the Vatican has a tough time getting a team together.

headline.seo: Vatican City Faces Monaco in a Rare Soccer Outing
headline.main: A Friendly Game for a Beatific State
headline.print_headline: A Friendly Game for a Beatific State
